[30;1m23 | [0m[35m# Step 1 can be done with ATD well as we've done before in other[0m
[30;1m24 | [0m[35m# contexts. Step 2 is done in Python (pysemgrep) by loading a JSON[0m
[30;1m25 | [0m[35m# file at runtime. For OCaml (semgrep-core), it was done by an extra[0m
[30;1m26 | [0m[35m# build step that takes the JSON data and turns it into OCaml (using[0m
[30;1m27 | [0m[35m# jinja). I wanted to eliminate the jinja build step which is weird to[0m
[30;1m28 | [0m[35m# have in an OCaml project (extra setup, needs extra expertise). Dune[0m

[30;1m6 | [0m[35m# Edit this file to add or modify a language, then run 'make' to[0m

[30;1m8 | [0m[35m#[0m
[30;1m9 | [0m[35m###########################################################################[0m
[30;1m10 | [0m[35m# Design notes:[0m

[31m--[ [0m[34mMatch #[0m[33m232[0m[34m of [0m[33m864[0m[31m ]--[0m

[30;1m127 | [0m[35m    # File extensions that are commonly used for the language, including[0m
[30;1m128 | [0m[35m    # the period.[0m
[30;1m129 | [0m[35m    # Several languages may share an extension unlike for reverse_exts.[0m
[30;1m130 | [0m[35m    # TODO: find out and explain why "" is a valid extension and why[0m
[30;1m131 | [0m[35m    #       [""] works but [] doesn't. (I suspect it's an implementation[0m
[30;1m132 | [0m[35m    #       quirk that should be fixed)[0m
[30;1m133 | [0m[35m    # TODO: document what qualifies as an extension since don't seem to[0m

[31m--[ [0m[34mMatch #[0m[33m233[0m[34m of [0m[33m864[0m[31m ]--[0m
   Rule Id: [34mBD000610[0m
       Tag: [34mSecurity.Backdoor.LOLBAS.Linux[0m
  Severity: [36mModerate[0m, Confidence: [36mLow[0m
  Filename: [33m/semgrep-1.118.0/src/semgrep/semgrep_interfaces/generate.py[0m
   Pattern: [32m\s(apt|apt\-get|aria2c|arp|ash|awk|base64|bash|bpftrace|busybox|cat|chmod|chown|cp|cpan|cpulimit|crontab|csh|curl|cut|dash|dd|diff|dmesg|dmsetup|dnf|docker|dpkg|easy_install|ed|emacs|env|expand|expect|facter|find|finger|flock|fmt|ftp|gawk|gdb|gimp|git|grep|head|iftop|ionice|ip|irb|jjs|journalctl|jrunscript|ksh|ld\.so|ldconfig|logsave|ltrace|lua|mail|mawk|mount|mtr|mv|mysql|nano|nawk|nc|nice|nl|nmap|node|od|openssl|perl|pg|php|pic|pico|pip|puppet|readelf|red|rlogin|rlwrap|rpm|rpmquery|rsync|ruby|run\-mailcap|run\-parts|rvim|scp|screen|script|sed|service|setarch|sftp|shuf|smbclient|socat|sort|sqlite3|ssh|start\-stop\-daemon|stdbuf|strace|systemctl|tail|tar|taskset|tclsh|tcpdump|tee|telnet|tftp|time|timeout|tmux|top|ul|unexpand|uniq|unshare|vi|vim|watch|wget|whois|wish|xargs|xxd|yum|zsh|zypper)\s[0m
[30;1m58 | [0m[35m# data in OCaml format like we wanted without going through JSON, so[0m
[30;1m59 | [0m[35m# that's not an effort we could avoid.[0m
[30;1m60 | [0m[35m#[0m
[30;1m61 | [0m[35m# In conclusion, having a single generate script that only depends on a[0m
[30;1m62 | [0m[35m# vanilla installation of Python 3 is simpler than ATD to set up for[0m

[30;1m175 | [0m[35m    [manifest_deps] can be None in the case where we did not find a manifest file[0m
[30;1m176 | [0m[35m    [dep_sources] is a list to account for yarn lockfiles, where a package comes with a list of[0m
[30;1m177 | [0m[35m    all the version constraints that produced it, and it's possible to have one package installed[0m
[30;1m178 | [0m[35m    at multiple versions[0m

[30;1m838 | [0m[35m        """Convert semgrep's path include/exclude patterns to wcmatch's glob patterns.[0m
[30;1m839 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m840 | [0m[35m        In semgrep, pattern "foo/bar" should match paths "x/foo/bar", "foo/bar/x", and[0m
[30;1m841 | [0m[35m        "x/foo/bar/x". It implicitly matches zero or more directories at the beginning and the end[0m
[30;1m842 | [0m[35m        of the pattern. In contrast, we have to explicitly specify the globstar (**) patterns in[0m
[30;1m843 | [0m[35m        wcmatch. This function will convert a pattern "foo/bar" into "**/foo/bar" and[0m
[30;1m844 | [0m[35m        "**/foo/bar/**". We need the pattern without the trailing "/**" because "foo/bar.py/**"[0m

[30;1m140 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m141 | [0m[35m    The end result of this parsing is a set of human-readable patterns corresponding to gitignore sy[0m

[30;1m57 | [0m[35m        # The __hash__ of every single element in a Set[Tag] will be evaluated each time[0m
[30;1m58 | [0m[35m        # that a set calls its `.disjoint()` method, which may be called hundreds of[0m
[30;1m59 | [0m[35m        # times when scanning a page of links for packages with tags matching that[0m
[30;1m60 | [0m[35m        # Set[Tag]. Pre-computing the value here produces significant speedups for[0m
[30;1m61 | [0m[35m        # downstream consumers.[0m

[30;1m281 | [0m[35m        ``other`` is consumed and its result is included in the list of results.[0m
